so I will start by explaining a little bit more about why we're working with this
so how are buildings in maps actually created well
changes are notified to the municipality so when someone builds something on their property they're supposed to send
in an application for a building permit which allows the municipality to know about the change and they can update
their data so this is what is supposed to happen but as we all know people build
illegally they don't always follow the rules so change has happened without the municipality of being notified
but also in 2015 the politicians decided that residents are actually allowed to
build without notifying the municipality if they're building something that is below 50 square meters and as long as
it's within the regulation in that area so when they are finished building they are
still supposed to notify the municipality and say I've built this but that rarely happens
so usually there are a lot of like small garages and greenhouses that are built without the municipality getting
notified at all so there's a second way that changes are being made
and that is that is by looking at what is visible in aerial images and then
manually constructing buildings from that so that means that someone has to sit and manually look through all the aerial
images and see where there are differences and try to make the map
correspond to what is visible so why is it important to have correct
building data well first of all due to land use we need to know how much of our land we're
building on which is important for all types of considerations for example
flood it's also important due to taxes a lot of Norwegian municipalities have
property taxes and those won't be correct unless the building data is
it's important for the fire department in case of emergency and we also want this data to be correct
when we're buying a property or selling a property but this process of looking at these
aerial images and trying to see where there are changes in buildings it's a
very time consuming job it's quite expensive and it it's not uh certain that you will

separate interpreters and it can communicate over synchronized share memory and queue
so our sample generator can be one process the training data Reservoir can be
another the validation a third and our AI model can run in a fourth process
and then data can flow through these processes with the shared memory in the queues
